title: Two Sum
concept: Find if any two numbers sum to a target.
prompt: Return YES if any pair sums to the target, else NO.

javascript.starter: const arr=[2,7,11,15];const t=9;let seen=new Set();let ok=false;for(const n of arr){if(seen.has(t-n))ok=true;seen.add(n);}console.log(ok?'YES':'NO');

tests.run: (()=>{__RESET__();const arr=[2,7,11,15];const t=9;let seen=new Set(),ok=false;for(const n of arr){if(seen.has(t-n))ok=true;seen.add(n);}console.log(ok?'YES':'NO');return __LOGS__[0]==='YES';})()

python.starter:
n=int(input())
arr=list(map(int,input().split()))
t=int(input())
seen=set()
ok=False
for num in arr:
    if t-num in seen:
        ok=True
    seen.add(num)
print('YES' if ok else 'NO')

java.starter: import java.util.*;public class Main{public static void main(String[] args){Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);int n=sc.nextInt();int[] a=new int[n];for(int i=0;i<n;i++)a[i]=sc.nextInt();int t=sc.nextInt();Set<Integer> s=new HashSet<>();boolean ok=false;for(int x:a){if(s.contains(t-x))ok=true;s.add(x);}System.out.println(ok?"YES":"NO");}}
